response.answer_text: The strategy is an integrated set of actions that must create a sustainable atmosphere for your mission or an advantage over your competitors. For many organizations, the strategy is opportunistic and reactive when the business community puts pressure on the company. For successful organizations, the strategy is constantly to move to a new position in the business. For high-performance organizations, the strategy is to use strategic thinking to create new entrepreneurs and innovative approaches to stay ahead of a rapidly changing business environment. These are the common areas of strategic implications. Operational Excellence Sound Financial Management Technology Solutions and Accelerators Customer / Member Engagement Branding Advocacy / Regulatory Governance Leadership Philanthropy The strategic implications can also be extended to SWOT, PESTLE and other competitive aspects of an organization. SWOT stands for Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, and Threats, and so a SWOT Analysis is a technique for assessing these four aspects of your business. PEST stands for political, economic, socio-cultural and technological which describes a framework of macro-environmental factors used in the environmental scanning component of strategic management.
